finalProject

Class Localization

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalProject.Localization

  • public class Localization
extends java.lang.Object
    The class runs before either forward or defense are called and is used to set an original position for the robot. The first action taken is to perform an ultrasonic localization in order to determine a general area for the robot. Then the robot moves toward the perpendicular cross of the grid lines in order to be able to clock the grid lines. Once it moves to the perpendicular cross, the robot rotates until four lines have been crossed, using the light sensor to determine when this occurs. Once this has happened, the robot uses trigonometry to calculate its position and angle error and centers itself on the cross with its direction pointed to zero degrees.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Ian Gauthier, Ilana Haddad, Tristan Bouchard, Tyrone Wong, Alexandre Tessier

    • Method Detail

      • doLocalization

        public void doLocalization(int fwdCorner)
        The method should first perform a ultrasonic localization to find the direction to the perpendicular cross of the grid lines. The robot should then move to that cross and past it in order to make the robot within reach of all four grid lines that need to be clocked. The robot should then rotate until it finds four grid lines and then take note of all of them using the light sensor. Finally the brick should perform trig to find both the error in position and heading and then move to a heading and position of zero.
        Parameters:
        fwdCorner - the corner in which the robot begins

      • turnClockwise

        public void turnClockwise()
        Turn the robot clockwise when called until told to stop.

      • turnCounterClockwise

        public void turnCounterClockwise()
        Turn the robot counter clockwise when called until told to stop.

      • wallDetected

        public boolean wallDetected()
        Test whether or not the ultrasonic sensor has seen the wall or not.
        Returns:
        true if there has been a walled detected and false if it has not
